page.title: 09Kilmond Wood Quarry
page.content: Kilmond Wood Quarry is the only quarry in the block area that is still in operation.At present it is owned by Hargreaves,a local haulage and highway maintenance firm.There is only one permanent employee who is generally occupied in supervising the premises and controlling the public weighbridge situated near the entrance.When large amounts of ballast are needed the firm contracts out to another firm called Budge.Local people do visit the quarry to order various amounts of gravel or loose chippings. During the construction of the A66 dual carriageway the quarry was very busy with blasting,rock sorting and crushing.Considerably more local men were employed then.Unfortunately,the completion of the roadworks signalled an immediate fall in production and a reduction in the number of employees.
